text: Daniel Chee Tsui (, born February 28, 1939) is a Chinese-born American physicist. He is a professor at Princeton University. Tsui shared the 1998 Nobel Prize in Physics with Robert B. Laughlin and Horst L. St√∂rmer for their discovery of fractional quantum Hall effect. He was born in Henan, China. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:Chinese physicists Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from New Jersey Category:People from Princeton, New Jersey Category:People from Henan
title: Daniel C. Tsui
